author: pburba
msg: Implement Issue #2818: Provide an API which allows for merging of arbitrary
revision ranges as well as the command line enhancements to support the same.
With this patch you can now specify multiple revision ranges to merge by
using the -c and/or -r option multiple times.
As can be seen from the example, mixing additive and subtractive revisions
and ranges is allowed.  Ranges are compacted to their nominal representation
before being applied (which may be a no-op).
(svn_client_merge_peg3): Change API to accept array of
requested_ranges to better reflect what it is.  Replace is_rollback
argument with is_three_way_merge as we are now supporting multiple
discontinuous ranges some of which may be rollbacks and some not.
Deal with the fact that we need to handle more than one contiguous
as merge_type_merge, rather use the new type merge_type_3_way_merge.
argument with array of svn_merge_range_t *'s.  Replace is_rollback
argument with is_three_way_merge.  Update calls to
(populate_remaining_ranges): Removed the is_rollback arg, no need to
replace it with is_three_way_merge as elsewhere since we can't get here
unless this is merge between the same URLs.  Update call to
picking the next end rev.  If the next range is subtractive and and
additive range was the previous range processed then don't use it.
Also, if the next range does not overlap with the previous range then
Don't remove subtractive ranges when processing additive ranges.
argument with is_three_way_merge.  Update call to update_wc_mergeinfo().
(do_merge): Replace svn_revnum_t revision1 and revision2 arguments with
array of merge_rev_range_t *.  Update call to drive_merge_report_editor
(do_single_file_merge): You've heard if before by now, pitch the two
revision args in favor of an array of revision.  is_rollback arg is
(discover_and_merge_children): Again is_rollback is no longer needed
and we're processing and array of ranges instead of a single contiguous
range.  Update the various calls that want that array rather than the
(svn_client_merge3): Create a rangelist with one range to feed to
do_merge, disco_children, and all the other range hungry beasties.
(svn_client_merge_peg3): Requisite rangelist replacement of range args.
Marvel at the code churn required to transform an array of opt revisions
into actual revision numbers and then compact these.
(svn_client_merge_peg2): Create a rangelist with one range to pass to
(main): Initialize new ranges_to_merge member of svn_cl__opt_state_t.
Don't error out on finding multiple -r and/or -c options, store them in
ranges_to_merge until we know the subcommand, and if it's not merge, then
(svn_cl__merge): Handle the fact that revision ranges for merge are now in
svn_cl__opt_state_t's ramges_to_merge member. Update call to
